title: Which scientific journal article has the most authors? - Quora

response.answer_text: Articles written by giant collaborations fall under this category. Two groups I can think of are: 1. The LIGO collaboration:[1] Their paper author lists look like this:[2]  But they are blown out of the water by… 2. The CERN groups like ATLAS collaboration.[3] The main page has a deceptively small author list.[4]  But go inside…  Pages and pages of this. Nature had an article about how this specific paper had set the record with having more than 5000 authors![5] Footnotes[1] LSC - LIGO Scientific Collaboration[2] Gravitational-wave constraints on the equatorial ellipticity of millisecond pulsars[3] The Collaboration[4] Combined Measurement of the Higgs Boson Mass in $pp$ Collisions at $\sqrt{s}=7$ and 8 TeV with the ATLAS and CMS Experiments[5] Physics paper sets record with more than 5,000 authors

The above paper has 5154 authors and broke the records to become the research article with largest contributors ATLAS and CMS are two detectors under CERN and the paper above was the first paper born out of collaboration between these two teams
